skillTree.localised_description: Mighty, horned, reptilian beasts, Stegadons are naturally armoured with bony scales and spikes protruding from their crests.

effects.description: Mount: Ancient Stegadon

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit can fire while on the move.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

ui_effects.localised_text: Enemies hit by lightning strikes in melee combat
Explosion does not affect friendly troops

skillTree.localised_description: Lizardmen can move with deceptive speed and agility when they have to.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10%

skillTree.localised_description: Across the gulf of space, the serene Potec has shared the secrets of time so that the Lizardmen may protect themselves against supernatural attack.

effects.description: Spell resistance: 10%
Bound spell: "Urannon's Thunderbolt"

skillTree.localised_description: "Brother of Great Tlazcotl, Tepok of the Air shall always be honoured. Let it be done."

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
	(own army)

Speed: +10%
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 5%
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those sensitive to the skeins of destiny can feel its precarious balance as well as sense Tetto’eko’s uncanny ability to shift the winds of fate his own way.

effects.description: Army Ability: "Unleash the Winds"

skillTree.localised_description: By Tetto’eko’s predictions, many dire events have been averted before they were allowed to happen. It was Tetto’eko and his precognitive skills that defeated the Skaven forces that massed once again at Quetza. It was Tetto’eko that pointed the great Chameleon Skink Oxyotl towards the hidden enclave of Skaven Assassins that was waiting to ambush Lord Mazdamundi.

effects.description:
Reinforcement range: +50%
	(Lord's army)
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +50%

Enemy Hero action success chance: -25%
	(enemy characters in region)

skillTree.localised_description: It has been said that the Lizardmen have never lost a battle with Tetto’eko present. So famous are Tetto’eko’s predictions that he is afforded the same reverence as a Slann - the Temple Guard bowing low as the Skink hovers across the city to attend to his many star-viewings.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +8 for melee infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 10% for melee infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Attribute: Immune to Psychology
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Tetto'eko's appearance on the battlefield heralds events of such importance that heavenly bodies have been known to realign themselves in his favour.

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: -15
	(local region)
Winds of Magic power reserve: +10 per turn
Passive ability: "Herald of Cosmic Events"

skillTree.localised_description: At over a century old, Tetto’eko is ancient for a Skink, yet his mind is quick and his unprecedented ability to predict the future only seems to improve.

effects.description:
Unlocks Hero recruitment: Skink Priest
	(all provinces)

Hero recruit rank: +5 for Skink Priests
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: The Skink Priest was spawned when the true moon obscured the cursed second moon; this was previously seen as an ill omen, but with the coming of Tetto’eko it has now been pronounced as a sign of good fortune.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

skillTree.localised_description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

factionEffects.localised_description: The temple-city is the destination for those Slann Mage-Priests who specialise as astromancers and prognosticators; their observations of the moon and stars made for stunningly accurate predictions of future events.
